ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This was the longest paper I had ever worked on, so this developed my skills in long-term research.

In contrast to all other courses I have taken here, this class taught me how to nurture a group of ideas over a period of four months and to prune them with the goal of producing a coherent and cogent essay. I also learned how to structure a research plan.
I learned how to do independent research and write a much longer paper than I'd ever written before. Because I enjoyed writing my thesis so much, I took that as a sign that I'll like grad school!

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I really appreciated the early and clear deadlines for the Lit major. While my friends in other majors were really struggling during finals, my thesis had been turned in already! I felt that the schedule allowed me to give my thesis the full attention that I wanted to give it.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes! This was a really valuable experience. I got to pursue a subject that really interested me, I got to work one-on-one with a professor whom I greatly respect, and I got to learn how to write a long paper!
